title: Manage Headway Adherence
description: On a high-frequency bus route, two buses get too close together (bus bunching). A dispatcher must intervene to even out the spacing.

tasks.description: The system alerts the dispatcher that the headway between two buses on a route has fallen below the 3-minute minimum.
tasks.expected_outcome: The dispatcher is alerted to the bus bunching issue.

tasks.description: The dispatcher contacts the driver of the first bus via radio.
tasks.expected_outcome: Communication is established with the lead bus.

tasks.description: Instruct the driver of the first bus to not pick up passengers at the next two stops to create space behind them.
tasks.expected_outcome: The driver receives and acknowledges the instruction.

tasks.description: Monitor the route's headway in real-time until the spacing returns to the desired level.
tasks.expected_outcome: The dispatcher confirms that the intervention was successful and the headway is restored.
